name: velocity-animate
readme: ##Velocity (1.0.0) **Docs** [VelocityJS.org](http://VelocityJS.org) **Quickstart** `bower install velocity` `npm install velocity-animate` `` ###**Updates** - **1.0.0**: Important! File name change. See [VelocityJS.org/#dependencies](http://VelocityJS.org/#dependencies) for more information. - **0.1.0**: `stop` now stops animations *immediately* (instead of just clearing the remainder of the animation queue). No other backwards-incompatible changes were made. ###**Learn** - **Motion design**: http://smashingmagazine.com/2014/06/18/faster-ui-animations-with-velocity-js - **Performance comparisons**: http://davidwalsh.name/css-js-animation - **Workflow**: http://css-tricks.com/improving-ui-animation-workflow-velocity-js ###**Comparisons** - **Famo.us** is a full-fledged *mobile app framework* built around a physics engine. - **CSS transitions** are meant for simple interface flourishes triggered by hover states. - **jQuery's $.animate()** is slow and poorly-equipped for motion design. - **Velocity** allows you to inject rich motion design into your UI. ###**Credits** - Stripe sponsors Velocity's development. - BrowserStack provides Velocity's testing services. ==== [MIT License](LICENSE.md).
